page.title: 13Water - The Yeo Reservoir
page.content: In order to provide water for the thirsty towns of Bristol and Bath, and the surrounding countryside, it was decided to capture the water flowing from the River Yeo and various springs in the Mendip Hills in the valley below Blagdon to form the Yeo Reservoir. Some of the villages in the area have benefitted considerably from this scheme - not only does the lake add greatly to the beauty of the valley but in order to safeguard the purity of the water the villages of Butcombe, Compton Martin and Blagdon had all to be provided with sewers and sewage-disposal works, which other less fortunate areas still lack in 1985! There is an intersting obelisk on the hill above Chew Stoke which is in fact an air ventilation shaft for the water pipe which runs from Chewton Mendip to Bristol.
